full_text: WSJ reporting that Pfizer now expects it can only ship *half* of the Covid-19 vaccines it had planned this year because of supply chain problems. Says it can still hit a billion doses in 2021.

BREAKING— Pfizer is slashing its expected delivery of vaccine doses from 100 million to 50 million because of production quality issues. Everyone needs 2 doses. So this is a big hit. #COVID19 https://t.co/VfJXorRAWA

WSJ: Pfizer now expects to ship half the doses it had originally planned, from 100 million doses down to 50 million, after finding raw materials in early production didn’t meet its standards.
https://t.co/82Malmr24u

The Department of Homeland Security issues a warning that hackers are targeting key actors in the coronavirus vaccine supply chain and points to IBM's findings of malicious activity https://t.co/jeMGbdwSvB

"MUJI: 100% Xinjiang Cotton and Uyghur Tears." 👀 Artist @badiucao just uploaded some scathing works — criticism of corporations' connections to Xinjiang labor and/or pushback against Congressional legislation on supply chain integrity. The art is free: https://t.co/ze8K8peKKk https://t.co/tqdjX1uai2
@TimOBrien Which is why we needed a government that was more concerned about the supply chain and delivery logistics than about naming the vaccine after Trump.

As China edges towards a food crisis, it looks at India to feed its citizens

Chinese President had termed wastage of food in China as 'shocking' and 'distressing'. In August this year, he launched campaign in the country called 'Operation Empty Plate'

https://t.co/oZbu5dQgws

Hackers are targeting key actors in the coronavirus vaccine supply chain as distribution gets underway, according to new warnings by the Department of Homeland Security and IBM, which discovered the malicious activity. https://t.co/pI47PeHavT

Pfizer expects to ship half of the Covid-19 vaccines it originally planned for this year because of supply-chain problems, but still expects to roll out more than a billion doses in 2021 https://t.co/1Tof1FAyzZ
JUST IN: Pfizer shares fell as much as 3.1% after Dow Jones reported that it cut the number of Covid-19 vaccine doses it plans to ship this year because of supply-chain issues https://t.co/gMRMlPZFG0

(WSJ) - Pfizer Inc. expects to ship half of the Covid-19 vaccines it originally planned for this year because of supply-chain problems, but still expects to roll out more than a billion doses in 2021.

⁦@WSJ⁩ $PFE  https://t.co/7PqEs44fEe

As warned, the vaccine delivery is big and messy and bulky and you can pre-write these kinds of stories now. It is the nature of logistics. It gets better over time; supply chain blips get fixed, things go faster. Not ideal but not surprising. Rolling recovery well into 2021. https://t.co/D2qAR2ENcB
get ready to see a lot of the phrase "supply-chain problems" https://t.co/yiqErCPDnC

Calculated cyber-attacks have been targeting organizations involved in the COVID-19 vaccinations supply chain.

Here's how this e-grocer cuts out three steps in the normal grocery-store supply chain https://t.co/znnb4W0dYE

"Palm oil, it's a critical ingredient. But it's driving mass deforestation. We (at @MarsGlobal) are deforestation-free and we've done that by massively simplifying our supply chain. Interestingly it's also saving us money." Barry Parkin
#SustainableBizSummit https://t.co/8VCGuSPZez

Remember to give thanks 2day to all the farm families & workers along the food supply chain who help put food on our tables every day of the yr. God Bless America’s bounty & the farmers +laborers so others don’t go hungry. HAPPY THANKSGIVING

As the UKs entire hospitality sector and supply chain waits for today’s tier announcement, just remember, that whilst other countries were closing borders and taking immediate action....we were told to wash our hands and sing happy birthday twice. World leading.

Amazon workers are continuing to organize across the supply chain, and even in the US, there’s now a warehouse union drive. hard to overstate how critical these efforts are—they’re trying to turn the tide on a very dark future https://t.co/oYervWIUQc

"the 32 billion items that had been ordered by the Parallel Supply Chain by 31 July could last around five years" observes the NAO.
